jam.data
Class Monitor

java.lang.Object
  jam.data.Monitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is for monitoring the status of data acquisition. Monitors can show the status of things like event rates, beam current, rate of growth in a histogram, etc.

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.5,0.9
Author:
Ken Swartz, Dale Visser
See Also:
Serialized Form

public java.lang.String getName()

Parameters:

reset

public void reset()
Sets this monitor's value to zero.

update

public void update()
Updates this monitor, calculating the latest monitor values. Keeps the most recent value, too, for rate determination.

setThreshold

public void setThreshold(double inThreshold)
Sets the threshold value, which is the minimum value for a monitor to have without MonitorControl issuing a warning beep.

Parameters:
inThreshold - the new minimum
See Also:
MonitorControl

getThreshold

public double getThreshold()
Returns the threshold value for this monitor.

Returns:
the threshold value

setMaximum

public void setMaximum(double inMaximum)
Sets the maximum value, which is the maximum value for a monitor to have without MonitorControl issuing a warning beep.

Parameters:
inMaximum - the new maximum
See Also:
MonitorControl

getMaximum

public double getMaximum()
Returns the maximum value for this monitor.

Returns:
the maximum value for this monitor

setAlarm

public void setAlarm(boolean inAlarm)
Sets whether the alarm is activated. If the alarm is not activated, MonitorControl simply turns the indicator bar red when the value is below threshold or above the maximum. If it is activated, an alarm sound is issued too.

Parameters:
inAlarm - true if an audible alarm is desired, false if not

getAlarm

public boolean getAlarm()
Returns whether alarm is activated or not.

Returns:
true if an audible alarm is desired, false if not

setAudioClip

public void setAudioClip(java.applet.AudioClip audioClip)
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED, Sets an AudioClip object to be played for alarms if the alarm is enabled. Currently, the plan is to fully implement this when the JDK 1.2 javax.media packeage is available.

getAudioClip

public java.applet.AudioClip getAudioClip()
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED, Gets the current AudioClip object to be played for alarms if the alarm is enabled. Currently, the plan is to fully implement this when the JDK 1.2 javax.media packeage is available.

Returns:
the sound clip for this monitor's alarm, null indicates that a default system beep is desired
